definition: to pluck (a string)/to play (a string instrument)/to spring or leap/to shoot (e.g. with a catapult)/(of cotton) to fluff or tease/to flick/to flip/to accuse/to impeach/elastic (of materials)
to push aside with the hand, foot, a stick etc/to dial/to allocate/to set aside (money)/to poke (the fire)/to pluck (a string instrument)/to turn round/classifier: group, batch

sentences.english: She touched the strings of the harp.
sentences.chinese: 她輕輕地彈撥豎琴的弦。

sentences.english: Guitar is played by plucking at the wires.
sentences.chinese: 吉他可用手指在絃線上彈撥。

sentences.english: Dombra (a plucked string instrument) is often used for accompaniment during the performance.
sentences.chinese: 表演時，用哈薩克族的彈撥樂器“冬不拉”伴奏。

sentences.english: It is in fact a case of slipping on a special T-shirt.
sentences.chinese: 這其實是一件特製T恤上的彈撥裝置。

sentences.english: The pipa is the most popular of China's many plucked stringed instruments.
sentences.chinese: 琵琶是中國許多彈撥絃樂器中最受人歡迎的一種。

sentences.english: Dongbula is a plucked stringed instrument of the Kazak ethnic group.
sentences.chinese: 冬不拉哈薩克族彈撥樂器。

sentences.english: Guzheng, also called Chinese zither, is one of the oldest Chinese musical plucking instruments.
sentences.chinese: 箏，又稱爲古箏，是中國最古老的彈撥樂器之一。

sentences.english: The Koto is a zither with 13 strings.
sentences.chinese: 古箏是一種有13根弦的彈撥樂器。

definition: (music) to change key/modulation/(of an employee) to be transferred to another post
music notation in which the notes Do, Re, Mi, Fa, Sol, La and Si are represented by numerals 1 to 7
to feel the pulse (TCM)/Taiwan pr. [zhen3 mo4]
